intro: Lasiandra fontanesiana var. major, commonly known as the giant lasiandra, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family native to South America. It is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length, often with a deep green color and prominent veins. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with multiple stems and a dense foliage structure. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservatories.
